column4: So anyway. Windows' UAC is _supposed_ to be annoying. (Micros~1 said so.)
i lasted about 4 months with it on, then it just started to be annoying because it was popping up while i played games >.>

The idea was kind of like this: a program needs admin rights without any reason --> it causes a lot of UAC popups --> user gets annoyed --> user complains to program's developers --> program gets fixed

But reality is kind of like this: a program needs admin rights without any reason --> it causes a lot of UAC popups --> user gets annoyed --> user complains to Windows developers --> UAC gets disabled
